results.title: Ben Nicholson 1894-1982
results.creator_credit: Anne Balfour Fraser, John Read, RM Productions and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
This is the story of the modern English artist Ben Nicholson as remembered by some of his closest friends and colleagues: Patrick Heron, Andras Kalman, Sir Leslie Martin, Angela Verren and Dr Felicitas Vogler. At the height of his career, Nicholson was one of the few artists to obtain international recognition with his contributions to modern art. His ‘white wall reliefs’ of the 30’s were his most notable work. This documentary traces his life and movements across Europe from Cumberland, St Ives to Switzerland - landscapes that were to influence his work greatly and remain a source of inspiration during his lifetime. Written and narrated by John Read.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Balfour Fraser, John Read, RM Productions and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Ben et Benedict = Ben and Benedict
results.brief_description:
Ben is a woman who never gets to do what she really wants to and is the victim of everybody and everything. Benedict is her imaginary creation: the girl who would respond with strength and mastery to situations Ben can only submit to. She is married to a cad who says he only married her because she was pregnant, and now he wants his freedom. Her real love is a fellow medical student who shows some interest in her. Nonetheless, she remains faithful to her unenthusiastic husband, until she becomes pregnant again. At this point she begins to act more like the Benedict of her dreams and less like the Ben she has lived as until now.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Paula Delsol ; writer, Paula Delsol ; photography, Claude Beausoleil ; music, Larry Martin ; title song, Pierre Barouh.
Cast: Francoise Lebrun, Andre Dussolier, Daniel Duval, Francois Perrier [voice only], Jacques Jeannet.

results.title: Beluga baby
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and Tony Westman
results.brief_description: The birth of a beluga whale is a seldom witnessed event. This is a record of the birth of a whale in the Vancouver Aquarium, the excitement building up to it, the labor, and the sudden and inexplicable death of the baby. Awards: Rio de Janeiro; Missoula.

results.title: Below the high plain
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Joe Scully and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Describes the State Electricity Commission’s hydro-electric scheme in north-eastern Victoria as seen by those who live on the job and those who find their recreation in this playground area of the ‘Australian Alps’. Set against a background of mountains, rivers and picturesque reservoirs in the mountain valleys, it is a documentary with a strong human element, describing in non-technical language the construction and operation of this major electricity undertaking. The film shows the alpine region in summer and winter, and the wide range of sport and natural attractions it offers the tourist.

results.title: Belonging: rituals of friendship and association in an Australian country town
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Philip Robertson
results.brief_description: About social interaction in a small New South Wales country town. Through the lives of four men the film reveals how newcomers to a community create a network of friends and acquaintances which gives them a sense of belonging. Records discussions in various clubs and associations, and suggests that in country towns there are clearly those who “belong” and those who don’t; women, aboriginals, the poor, the unemployed.

results.title: Belonging to the group: respect as a human value
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how an American family and a refugee family from Europe who move at the same time into a typical American community make adjustments and are accepted into groups at school, at work and at church. Discusses the need for people to respect and accept one another in a free society; explains the vital role of groups within a community; emphasises the importance of acquiring the feeling of belonging to a group; indicates community values and their relation to the democratic way of life.
results.title_for_label: Belonging to the group: respect as a human value

results.title: Belly on fire
results.brief_description: Looks at the work of the Pigbel Foundation in counteracting and preventing the spread of the pigbel disease which affects the intestines of New Guinea villagers. Shows how the poor diet of the people, inadequate hygiene and the sudden intake of pigmeat during festivals combine to trigger off the disastrous proliferation of the pigbel organism, particularly in young children. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Wilderness Society and Australian Conservation Foundation
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.
